     sometimes april snow buries the march flowers

     i'm not following your logic here

4.8.18  11:24 am   hey bill i play drums now but i've be trying to venture into keys so would it be a reasonable idea to just play out some rhythms on my drum kit a record the midi (i have an electronic kit) and then drag that around in garage band and try to make some notes and stuff into a melody? 

     i think if you play drums you are going to have a very easy time learning to play a keyboard

     always

     almost everything

4.7.18  11:08 pm   quit being so neato. turn down your neatometer. 

     i am getting a bigger one

4.7.18  10:46 pm   Hey bill i just started off creating my own music, art, and video. My main platform is Instagram at the moment but i don't tag due to the fact that i don't feel like sharing my content for at least another month. my friends don't approve that I've neglected playing video games with them to focus on what i consider my future career, due to this they've become very harsh toward the content i make. I do my works anonymously since i don't like having my face and real name online, but they haven't respected that and call me by  my real name in the comment sections of my posts. What should I do about them? 

     how did they find out about your account

     because spelling is popular

     yes

     views, not money

     sure

4.7.18  12:54 pm   Hi Bill, can you help me figure out what the piano player does in this  
https://youtu.be/PHo5U9Rios0 . i play the chord on the left hand and right after that, the arpeggio of the same chord on the right.

     it's a little less than that. it's usually just one or 2 notes in the left. focus on the whole part working together, not 2 separate hands. it's only about a total of 1.5 hands worth of work anyway

      that kinda sounds alike but it isn't similar enough. There some variations in the middle of the song too. Playing the way i said is too repetitive, i don't want to bore the listeners. Thanks 

     the trick to not bore the listeners is pay close attention to the vocal and lyric at all times, and ride underneath it, supporting it

4.7.18  12:48 pm   I like short melodies, but I also love and respect long, winding melodies. Do you feel the same?

     sure, but it's not entirely possible to describe a melody without hearing it or at least writing it down

4.7.18  12:47 pm   Do you dislike to dislike disliking things?

     sometimes it takes more PR than i would expect, but all in all i think it is the right position

     good
